eu.trentorise.opendata.commons

Class TodUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.trentorise.opendata.commons.TodUtils

  • public final class TodUtils
extends Object
    Utility funtions shared by Open Data in Trentino projects.
    Author:
    David Leoni

    • Method Detail

      • languageTagToLocale

        public static Locale languageTagToLocale(@Nullable
                         String languageTag)
        Converts a language code to Java Locale. On null input returns Locale.ROOT Notice Java 7 introduced Locale.forLanguageTag(String), but that method throws null pointer exception on null string, which unfortunately can happen quite often, so we use this method instead.
        See Also:
        Locale.forLanguageTag(String), localeToLanguageTag(Locale) for the inverse operation

      • localeToLanguageTag

        public static String localeToLanguageTag(@Nullable
                         Locale locale)
        Converts a Java locale to a String. On null input returns the empty string (which corresponds to Java Locale.ROOT)
        See Also:
        #languageTagToLocale(java.lang.String) for the inverse operation

      • addSlash

        public static String addSlash(String url)
        Returns a new url with a slash added at the end of provided url. If provided url already ends with a slash it just returns it.
        Parameters:
        url -

      • removeTrailingSlash

        public static String removeTrailingSlash(String url)
        Returns the provided url with all trailing slash at the end removed.

      • checkNotDirtyUrl

        public static String checkNotDirtyUrl(@Nullable
                      String url,
                      @Nullable
                      Object prependedErrorMessage)
        Deprecated. Moved to Preconditions.checkNotDirtyUrl(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object) @ param url the URL to check
        Checks if provided URL is to be considered 'dirty'. Method may use some heuristics to detect oddities, like i.e. the string "null" inside the url.
        Parameters:
        prependedErrorMessage - the exception message to use if the check fails; will be converted to a string using String.valueOf(Object) and prepended to more specific error messages.
        Returns:
        the non-dirty URL that was validated
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if provided URL fails validation.

      • parseNumericalId

        public static long parseNumericalId(String prefix,
                    String url)
        Deprecated. this shouldn't be here.....
        Parses an URL having a numeric ID after the provided prefix, i.e. for prefix 'http://entitypedia.org/concepts/' and url http://entitypedia.org/concepts/14324 returns 14324
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - on invalid URL

      • format

        public static String format(String template,
            @Nullable
            Object... args)
        Substitutes each %s in template with an argument. These are matched by position: the first %s gets args[0], etc. If there are more arguments than placeholders, the unmatched arguments will be appended to the end of the formatted message in square braces.

        (Copied from Guava's Preconditions.format(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...) )
        Parameters:
        template - a non-null string containing 0 or more %s placeholders.
        args - the arguments to be substituted into the message template. Arguments are converted to strings using String.valueOf(Object). Arguments can be null.
        Since:
        1.1

      • parseUrlParams

        public static com.google.common.collect.Multimap<String,String> parseUrlParams(String url)
        Extracts parameters from given url. Works also with multiple params with same name.
        Returns:
        map of param name : [args]
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException
        Since:
        1.1

      • putKey

        public static <K,V> com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap<K,V> putKey(Map<K,V> map,
                                                       K key,
                                                       V newObject)
        Returns a copy of provided map with newObject set under the given key. If key already exists replaces its value in the returned object. Not efficient, but sometimes we need it.
        Parameters:
        newObject - Must be an immutable object.
        Since:
        1.1

        Deprecated. experimental, try to avoid using it for now
        Throws:
        TodParseException
        Since:
        1.1
